item.title: Asia Eyes Calm Open as All-Out Conflict Risks Ease: Markets Wrap
item.description: Asian stocks are poised for a cautious open as fears subsided that Israel’s war against Iran would escalate into a wider conflict, with reports that Tehran wants to restart talks over its nuclear program.
item.dc:creator: Jason Scott

media:content.media:description: Market information displayed inside The Tokyo Stock Exchange (TSE) building, operated by Japan Exchange Group Inc. (JPX), in Tokyo, Japan, on Wednesday, April 9, 2025. Japanese stocks tumbled as concerns about US trade tariffs and wild swings on Wall Street sapped investor confidence, while the yen extended its rally.

item.title: Saskatchewan Could Double Oil Output to 1 Million Barrels a Day, Premier Says
item.description: Saskatchewan could more than double oil production to as much as 1 million barrels a day if federal regulations were eased, Premier Scott Moe said.
item.dc:creator: Robert Tuttle

media:content.media:description: An oil rig in Stoughton, Saskatchewan, Canada on Oct. 20, 2019.

item.title: Unclear Who Takes Over If Iran Collapses, Says Fmr Ambassador
item.description: Ryan Crocker, Former Ambassador to Afghanistan, Iraq, Pakistan, Syria, Kuwait & Lebanon speaks with Alix Steel and Romaine Bostick about the Iran & Israel conflict and nuclear sites being affected. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: SoftBank Seeks to Raise $4.9 Billion in T-Mobile Share Sale
item.description: SoftBank Group Corp. is seeking to raise as much as $4.9 billion in an unregistered overnight block sale of T-Mobile US Inc. shares, according to terms of the deal seen by Bloomberg News.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: A T-Mobile store in New York, US, on Monday, Oct. 21, 2024. T-Mobile US Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on October 23.

item.title: Oil Hedges Seeing a Huge Spike on Israel-Iran: Expert
item.description: Amrita Sen, Energy Aspects, Founder & Director of Research speaks with Alix Steel and Romaine Bostick about Iran and Israel conflict and the oil industry. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Top Oil Tanker Operator CEO on Risk of Mideast Conflict
item.description: Lars Barstad, Frontline Management CEO speaks with Romaine Bostick and Scarlet Fu about the Middle East conflict and how it is effecting the oil industry. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Kathy Kriskey on Diversifiers, Crude Oil, Commodities
item.description: Invesco Head of Alternatives ETF Strategy Kathy Kriskey discusses the need for constant diversification, the changes in the energy market, and exposure to commodities. She speaks with Scarlet Fu and Katie Greifeld on "Bloomberg ETF IQ." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Rich Colleges Would Face Lower Tax Hike Under Senate Bill
item.description: Wealthy US colleges scored a win on Monday with the release of Senate Republicans’ tax bill, which would institute a lower tax increase on endowments than what GOP House members have backed.
item.dc:creator: Amanda Albright

media:content.media:description: The Baker Library of the Harvard Business School on the Harvard University campus in Boston, Massachusetts, US, on Tuesday, May 27, 2025. President Donald Trump on Monday threatened to divert billions in grant dollars away from Harvard University and give those funds to trade schools across the US, escalating his clash with the elite institution.

item.title: Incoming Moelis CEO Discusses Geopolitical Risks | Bloomberg Markets 6/16/2025
item.description: "Bloomberg Markets" follows the market moves across every global asset class and discusses the biggest issues for Wall Street. Today's guests; Moelis and Co. Co-President and Co-Founder Navid Mahmoodzadegan and Red Lobster CEO Damola Adamolekun. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Ken Griffin on Trump, Harvard and Why Novice Investors Won’t Beat the Pros
item.description: The founder of $66 billion hedge fund Citadel is making waves in Miami, the nucleus of the new “Wall Street South.”
item.dc:creator: Sonali Basak

media:content.media:description: Ken Griffin at the Citadel offices in Miami.

item.title: Red Lobster CEO Says Customer Service Bolstered Rebound
item.description: Red Lobster CEO Damola Adamolekun says customer feedback has improved significantly since the restaurant chain emerged from bankruptcy with a revamped menu and a renewed focus on hospitality. He speaks on “Bloomberg Markets.”

item.title: Reb Lobster Recovers From Bankruptcy
item.description: Red Lobster’s new CEO said customer feedback has improved significantly since the restaurant chain emerged from bankruptcy with a revamped menu and a renewed focus on hospitality. Reb Lobster CEO Damola Adamolekun has more on the story. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Communications & Tech Today's Top S&P Sectors | Closing Bell
item.description: Comprehensive cross-platform coverage of the U.S. market close on Bloomberg Television, Bloomberg Radio, and YouTube with Romaine Bostick, Alix Steel, Scarlet Fu, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)

media:content.media:description: Estee Lauder Cos Inc/The Photographer: SeongJoon Cho/Bloomberg

item.title: Herbal Medicine Stock With No Sales Rallies 64,000%
item.description: A biotech stock focused on herbal medicine has surged by more than 46,000% so far this year and yet, the company itself has made zero revenue — much less turned a profit.
item.dc:creator: Angel Adegbesan

item.title: Victoria’s Secret Pressured by Second Investor Urging Change
item.description: Victoria’s Secret & Co. is being targeted by another activist investor seeking a shake-up of its business.
item.dc:creator: Crystal Tse, Lily Meier

item.title: US Bonds Extend Slide as Fed Seen on Hold Amid Oil Spike
item.description: US Treasuries fell amid bets that elevated oil prices will spur Federal Reserve policymakers to signal patience toward further interest-rate cuts when they meet this week.
item.dc:creator: Michael Mackenzie, Ruth Carson, Mary Nicola

media:content.media:description: TOPSHOT - Flags flutter along a bridge as a plume of heavy smoke and fire rise from an oil refinery in southern Tehran, after it was hit in an overnight Israeli strike, on June 15, 2025. Iran fired a fresh barrage of missiles at Israel, state television announced early on June 15, as the rivals exchanged fire for a third day. (Photo by ATTA KENARE / AFP) (Photo by ATTA KENARE/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: "A Ton of Opportunity" with Active ETFs: Yadava
item.description: Tushar Yadava, BlackRock market strategist for target allocation business, says he is always looking to bring active management into the portfolio and active ETFs are presenting a "ton" of opportunities. Bloomberg Intelligence says there are now more active ETFs on the market than passive ones. Yadava speaks with Scarlet Fu and Katie Greifeld on "Bloomberg ETF IQ." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Millennium Stake Sale Talks Value Hedge Fund at $14 Billion
item.description: Izzy Englander’s Millennium Management has been in discussions to sell a minority stake that values the hedge fund colossus at roughly $14 billion, according to a person familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Katherine Burton

media:content.media:description: Israel "Izzy" Englander, chairman and chief executive officer of Millennium Management LLC, speaks during the SkyBridge Alternatives (SALT) conference in Las Vegas, Nevada, U.S., on Wednesday, May 11, 2011. Speakers and attendees from around the world will discuss current global issues as well as investment ideas and strategies within the context of a changing economic environment.

item.title: Stocks Rise as Fear of All-Out Mideast War Eases: Markets Wrap
item.description: Relative calm returned to global markets, with stocks climbing and oil sinking alongside gold as fears subsided that Israel’s war against Iran would escalate into a wider conflict. News reports that Tehran wants to restart talks over its nuclear program also fueled risk-on sentiment.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

media:content.media:description: Israeli rescuers search through the rubble at the site of an overnight Iranian missile strike in Bat Yam on June 15, 2025.

item.title: US Stocks Rebound Strengthens on Reports Iran Is Open to Talks
item.description: US stocks rebounded on Monday as investors started snapping up risk-on assets after reports Iran is willing to resume nuclear talks with the US and de-escalate hostilities with Israel.
item.dc:creator: Joel Leon

media:content.media:description: An Ultra-Orthodox Jewish man surveys the site of a heavily damaged building after an overnight Iranian missile strike in Bnei Brak, Israel, on June 16.

item.title: Michael Saylor Shifts to Using Preferred Shares to Buy Bitcoin as Criticism Rises
item.description: Michael Saylor’s Strategy bought $1.05 billion in Bitcoin in the last seven days, the third consecutive week in which the cryptocurrency treasury company has used preferred shares exclusively instead of common stock to fund purchases.
item.dc:creator: Kirk Ogunrinde

media:content.media:description: Michael Saylor, co-founder and executive chairman of MicroStrategy Inc., departs after speaking during the Bitcoin 2025 conference in Las Vegas, Nevada, US, on Thursday, May 29, 2025. The event will examine Bitcoin's evolving global impact, with speakers from education, policy, finance, and technology.

item.title: Two-Factor Authentication Codes May Not Be So Private
item.description: A Bloomberg investigation shows one-time verification codes sent via text can be viewed by the intermediaries they pass through. Bloomberg’s Ryan Gallagher discusses what they mean and the safer way to receive these codes. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Solana Investors May Benefit As Financial Uses Grow, Cantor Says
item.description: Companies looking to invest in the cryptocurrency Solana may benefit from increased use of the coin in the financial industry, according to analysts at Cantor Fitzgerald.
item.dc:creator: Monique Mulima

item.title: Identifying for Big Visions From Early Players
item.description: AIX co-founder & General Partner Shaun Johnson says his firm is looking for early-stage founders who see opportunities to change the world. Johnson explains how M&A fits into that vision on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Social Media Platforms Push AI-Generated Ad Tools
item.description: MikMak CEO Rachel Tipograph says generative artificial intelligence is removing friction in the ad market, but humans are still needed for the creative side. She speaks with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Elliott Affiliate Weighs New Bid for Citgo as Legal Risks Ease
item.description: An Elliott Investment Management affiliate is considering rejoining the bidding for Citgo Petroleum Corp.’s parent company, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Nicolle Yapur

media:content.media:description: A Citgo Petroleum refinery in Lemont, Illinois, in 2010.

item.title: Oil Drops on Signs Conflict May Spare Iranian Crude Production
item.description: Oil fell on signs that the conflict in the Middle East may avoid disrupting crude production, with Iran seeking to deescalate hostilities with Israel.
item.dc:creator: Mia Gindis, Alex Longley

media:content.media:description: Vehicles jam a highway as a fire blazes nearby in the Shahran in Tehran on June 15, 2025. Photographer: Atta Kenare/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: Retail ETF Investors Grow in Europe | ETF IQ 6/16/2025
item.description: "Bloomberg ETF IQ" focuses on the opportunities, risks and current trends tied to the trillions of dollars in the global exchange traded funds industry. Today's guests: BlackRock Market Strategist for Target Allocation Business Tushar Tadava and Invesco Head of Alternatives ETF Strategy Kathy Kriskey. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Israel's Dermer: Want to Remove Iran's Ballistic Threat
item.description: US President Donald Trump says Iran wants to talk about de-escalating the conflict with Israel even as the two sides exchanged deadly fire for the fourth consecutive day. Israeli National Security Minister Ron Dermer, a key ally of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his main liaison with the US, speaks with Bloomberg Television about the conflict. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Why Tesla Could Have a Self-Driving Advantage
item.description: Tesla may have a leg up on rivals like Waymo in the self-driving market, according to Bloomberg Intelligence's Steve Man. He discusses Tesla’s edge with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

media:content.media:description: Tesla Motors Inc Photographer: Tomohiro Ohsumi/Bloomberg
